review_title: Good organizational goals, bad politics and bad intrenched faculty
job_title: Professor in Las Vegas, NM
pros: The school's mission is to be commended. Many people at Highlands are committed to helping students succeed.
cons: D-list tenured faculty who could not find work or have been fired elsewhere strive to maintain their power by making it inhospitable to new talent. These faculty openly recruit other poor candidates to maintain their power at the expense of people who are committed to serving the students and the institution as a whole. This includes doing things like delaying interviews to the last minute, creating unnecessary drama and being completely non responsive when given a task.

review_title: A fossilized public university with a compromised future.
job_title: Associate Professor in Las Vegas, NM
pros: Plenty of parking space (given that student body decreases by 10% annually...)
cons:
Unionized universities usually offer better work environments to their employees, however this university has been "sovietized" more than unionized: their Faculty Senate acts like a Politburo, with a few tenured faculty members bullying more recent faculty members, and monopolizing the conversation. Same thing with the much advertised (even though rare) research funds for faculty: the $$ go to the tenured faculty members who have connections. Management knows about the problem, but Admin. is too afraid of the tenured faculty members bullying the workplace, given that they may me given the boot if they try to solve that mess.
The campus is almost empty at all times, and the university is experiencing a 10% annual decrease in its student body. 
And who could blame the students for deserting the place, given that Las Vegas, NM is a place stuck in a time warp, and experiencing one of the highest levels of poverty in the nation? And there is not much that can be done to reverse the trend: the university's recruitment is already based on open enrolment, and students with a GPA of 2.8 are often accepted in the MBA program! This so-called "university" is on life support, with $$ coming from the new democratic Governor. This will not last forever, come back in 10 years and this so-called university will have closed its doors.

job_title: Athletic Trainer in Santa Fe, NM
pros: A place to keep you very busy.
cons: Not the smoothest administrative department.

job_title: Visiting Instructor in Las Vegas, NM
pros: Small classroom sizes, close network of colleagues, overall friendly place to work. I was able to really concentrate on preparing the course materials.  They offer a variety of classroom choices for either Interactive Television, Internet, and traditional classroom settings.  This provided a diverse teaching background with experience in multiple classroom settings.
cons: not a lot to do outside of work.  Limited resources for shopping for food and other items.  On the lower scale for salaries when compared to other Division II Universities in the US. Sometimes technology was lacking in update and reliability.  Definitely need to work on maintaining funds to keep up with changing trends in technology in the classroom.

job_title: Associate Professor in Las Cruces, NM
pros: Kids are great and most of them eager to learn. Close to great mountains and good scenery nearby. Just a few hours from a major Scout campground. Right on the edge of the mountains, so town itself is not that pretty, but old and interesting.
cons: Pressured to give passing grades to athletes who never attended class. A lot of back door deals done to gain political advantage instead of working with what the University President and Department Heads wanted - in other words, empire building. Town is very divided between Hispanics and old line Spanish. There have been efforts - including fire bombing cars - to chase out Caucasians and leave the school purely ethnic.

review_title: NMHU is friendly working environment, with knowledgable people and colleague
job_title: Graduate Assistant in Las Cruces, NM
pros:
NMHU staffs are very supportive, active. Have a chance and time for research and improve your knowledge.
No pressure for work, 
Will have a balance in work and life
Working place is fine
NMHU is the best place for someone who wants to change their life from big, crowded city and stressful company to teaching which is less stressful and more peaceful
cons:
Sometimes, people will feel bored because everyday is the same and low wage.
NMHU is not a very big university so it will be difficult for promotion or change to other firms.

review_title: Top management works for vested interest without any regards to help second command, students or hard working employees.
job_title: Students Affairs/Academic Support in Las Vegas, NM
pros: New construction looks good. There are some good professors and employees who can be counted on fingertips.
cons: Buildings don't make a good university. Quality professors, quality education and better services make a good university. Most of the employees are involved in departmental politics. Rumors and mudslinging are rampant. Every effort is made to make sure that honest and hard working employees don't get a raise or rise in the career.

job_title: Employee
pros: Some good hardworking employees and faculty
cons: There is a lack of proper communication between different departments. Some departments' heads are not professionally qualified. Hiring policies need to be changed. Human Resources Department needs a big change. Finance and Administration Department needs someone who can co-ordinate with the Department of Finance and Administration.
